title: Reconcile
body:
Summary: a recounting of meeting bucky for the first time which eventually leads to a series of events

Pairing(s): bucky barnes x reader

Requests: open!

Word Count: 2.8k

Warning(s): swearing, light smut

r:  Would you be willing to write a fic about Bucky and a wife that they got in an argument only for them to make up in a smutty way?

Marrying James Buchanan Barnes was probably the best decision Y/N had ever made. If someone had told her that she was to fall in love with The Winter Soldier three years ago, she would have reacted with a grimace and a snarky remark. The mere thought would have been revolting. Y/N’s hatred for Bucky Barnes stemmed from her gut wrenching hatred for SHIELD. It all started with a simple rejection letter.

“-we regret to inform you that you’re application has been denied for all intensive purposes that fall under SHIELD’s disclosure-” Y/N guffawed, slamming the manila file on the coffee table.

“Are you kidding me? I have met every single qualification. How could they reject my fucking application?” She seethed, gripping her hair in frustration. Her roommate, Talia, remained quiet. She picked up the paper and flattened it out.

“That’s odd,” Talia squinted at the paper.

“They never mentioned anything about ‘SHIELD’s disclosure’ in my letter.” She mumbled. Y/N huffed, crossing her arms in indignation. 

“That’s because you got an offer! You’re an agent.”

“Maybe it’s because you’re working for the CIA? SHIELD takes their loyalties very seriously.” Talia stated, ignoring Y/N’s remark.

“You’ve got too much intel with the government. They can’t risk recruiting someone with that much power.” She added, nudging Y/N. Y/N smiled softly

“Appealing to my ego doesn’t make this any-” Y/N stopped abruptly, an idea germinating in her mind.

“What?”

“I think I’ve got an idea.” 

“I doubt it’s a good one.”

Y/N found herself facing the doors of the Avengers Tower twenty minutes later. They can reject me all they want but I am not going to take no for an answer. The front desk was surprisingly empty and she found herself waiting in the lobby for awhile. That was until a familiar super soldier made his way towards the elevator before peering at her. Y/N held her breath.

“Can I help you?”

Bucky stared at her, his gaze unwavering. He looked different than what she had seen on tv. His hair was a warmer shade of brown and bundled at the nape of his neck. His eyes were lighter, a piercing cerulean blue. Y/N thought that the news channels altered his appearance significantly, making him look like he was surrounded by a cloak of exhaustion. He truly looked like a Roman statue carved out of limestone. Bucky cleared his throat.

“I’m here to talk to Maria Hill.” Y/N sputtered, slowly getting up. His gaze seemed to melt into a glare and she began to think he disliked her.

“She’s on her lunch break. She’ll be back in twenty minutes.” He replied curtly. Y/N nodded. Bucky didn’t move and neither did she.

“What are you here for?” He asked after a moment. Y/N fumbled for the paper in her pocket, handing it to him.

“I’m here to sort this out.”

“Seems to me like you’ve been rejected.” He said monotonously, gazing at her again. His demeanor hadn’t changed. Y/N swallowed.

“I plan to change that.”

“Good luck. SHIELD rarely takes rookies. Doubt you have the chops to get in.”

And with that he had disappeared. Y/N had decided from that moment onward that she loathed Bucky Barnes. He may be an Avenger, a hero, an icon, but he was a jerk in her eyes. An extremely handsome jerk.

Y/N had met Bucky several times later that month. At the supermarket. At the ATM. At the boardwalk. And every time he had taken the opportunity to harass her about her rejection letter. It was rude. He was well aware of that. But he couldn’t help himself. He was well aware she was a CIA agent. He was well aware that she had a high ranking. And he was well aware that SHIELD rejected her simply because of her allegiances. But he found it amusing that every time he brought it up, she would curl her lip in disgust and snap at him. She was cute. He’d never her tell her that though. 

“-he keeps finding me! I don’t know how! I should file a restraining order against him.” Y/N grumbled, smoothing the velvet dress down her hips. Talia simply laughed in response, gingerly applying red lipstick. The two of them had been cordially invited to a Philanthropic Gala for all Agencies tonight. Tony Stark had made a special request that the two attend.  At first, Y/N accepted only to later realize that the place would be swarming with press, Avengers, and agents. More specifically SHIELD agents. It was a scene she definitely didn’t belong to nor want to be apart of. But Talia convinced her otherwise and here she stood, clad in a beautiful myrtle green gown, minutes away from a social event that would be the death of her. 

“Don’t be so dramatic. And who wouldn’t want to be stalked by the Bucky Barnes. The man is basically a living breathing Greek God. Who knows, maybe tonight is your lucky night.” Talia winked, bumping her hip. Y/N fake gagged, following her best friend outside. The last thing she had hoped to see tonight was that man. She decided she would enjoy herself. A couple of mint juleps and some flirtatious remarks should do the trick. She’d ignore him. Hell, she wouldn’t even see him. Y/N decided he wouldn’t even make an appearance tonight.

The moment she entered the mansion, she knew she was wrong. Very very wrong. Bucky stood in the center of the ballroom, wearing a black Armani suit. Y/N wished her eyes didn’t linger as long as they did. Bucky noticed her presence a moment later, his blue eyes lazily trailed her body, almost as if he were drinking in her appearance. He raised his flute of champagne as a salute and smirked. Y/N pursed her lips and strode away. 

“I want to go home.” She muttered once she had found Talia.

“W-What? Y/N, we just got here!”

“I-I know but he’s here.”

“Don’t be so childish, there’s thousands of people here. I doubt he will have the chance to talk to you. Spend more time admiring the place than staring at him okay? It looks like Jay Gatsby threw this party. ” 

Y/N looked at her friend incredulously, before watching her walk towards the buffet. She was right. Tony had definitely outdone himself. The rented mansion looked luxurious with the extravagant chandeliers and live symphonic music. It really did look like a Gatsby themed party. For the next hour, Y/N conversed with Talia’s teammates, trying to ignore the burning feeling in the pit of her stomach every time they brought up SHIELD. It had been a month since Maria Hill told her she couldn’t change Director Fury’s decision. It’s been a month and it still hurt. 

“You seem like a woman who’s dying to get out of this place.”

Y/N turned around at the gravely voice. A tall lanky man stood before her, He offered a lopsided grin.

“Nolan Irvine. May I have this dance?”

Y/N smiled, taking his hand. Bucky watched from afar, feeling his stomach turn at the sight. An unexplained feeling of jealousy blossomed in his chest and he wished he could look away. Yet his eyes were glued to the couple. Nolan was strange, Y/N could tell right off the bat. He filled their conversation with corny jokes and gripped her waist a little too tight when she didn’t give him the reaction he had wanted.

“I think I need a drink. If you would excuse me-”

“Awww no. My favorite song just came on. You owe me just one more dance.” 

Y/N glared at him, suddenly turning rigid in his grasp. His brown eyes peered at her menacingly, almost daring her to do something.

“I do not owe you anything.” 

She squeezed his shoulder harder than he had been squeezing her waist. Maybe slightly too hard. Nolan shrieked at the tight squeeze, shrugging away from her. Y/N simply twirled, grasping a flute from one of the waiters silver platters and disappearing into the sea of couples. She watched from the corner, eyeing Nolan from afar. He approached other women only to be rejected. She couldn’t help but smirk.

“That was quite a show.”

Bucky had found her. Y/N shut her eyes.

“If you’re referring to the asshole I danced with awhile ago, then I’d tell you that was only a teaser of what would happen.”

Bucky quietly laughed and Y/N found herself smiling.

“Well, how about I redeem your night by asking for a dance?”

“And how exactly will that redeem my night?”

“Well, you’ll be dancing with me.”

“How cocky.”

“Not cocky, just honest.”

“Are you going to bring up my rejection letter?”

“Depends.”

Y/N glared at him and he laughed, lifting his arms up.

“Okay okay I won’t. I promise.”

Y/N weighed her options. Talia had already found a date and it would be a good two hours until this party ended. If she stayed in her spot, it would be only a matter of time till Nolan or someone worse found her. I could give him a piece of my mind. She shook her head and studied Bucky. His hair was slicked back and his lips looked alarmingly pink tonight. Y/N found herself staring, wondering if they felt as soft as they looked. She blinked, It’s the alcohol. Definitely the alcohol.

“Alright.”

Bucky was a surprisingly good dancer, much to Y/N’s surprise. He expertly twirled her and moved with confidence to the beat of the music. 

“You can dance.”

“You sound shocked.”

“I didn’t know jerks could dance.”

Bucky looked at her, slightly appalled.

“You think I’m a jerk?”

“You’ve been harassing me for the past month, Barnes.”

He frowned.

“I saw it more as teasing. I apologize.”

And the rest of the conversation was a blur of flirtatious comments and amusing remarks. He held Y/N close. She was intoxicating in every way and the two of them found themselves not wanting the night to end. Talia had ended up leaving earlier with her date and informed Y/N with a text and a promise of breakfast on her the following morning. Bucky offered to walk her home.

“I had fun tonight.” He mumbled.

“Can’t say the same.” She replied, leaning on the door frame. The two chuckled softly before falling in a comfortable silence. Y/N was buzzing, either from the alcohol or Bucky. She couldn’t tell but she didn’t want the feeling to go away.

“Would it be weird to kiss you right now?” He asked after a moment. Y/N froze, her voice betraying her. She shook her head and Bucky took the small gesture as a yes, bending his head and tentatively pressing his lips onto hers. His lips were warm and tasted sweet. Y/N hummed against him, almost sighing with relief. His hands cupped her jaw softly and Y/N tugged at the collar of his suit almost as if to brace herself. He broke away.

“I’ll see you later, yeah?”

“Later” turned into a date, and one date turned into many. Before they knew it, the two were engaged and later married. 

“I still can’t believe you hated me.” Bucky mumbled, filing through the mail.

“I didn’t hate you, I hated the fact that you have history with SHIELD.” Y/N responded, wrapping her arms around his waist. The two had spent the morning recounting their history as a means of passing time. 

“Right, so pent up anger on an agency correlates with being angry at a random guy.”

“You brought up my rejection every time we met!” She responded, pressing ghost kisses against his neck. 

“I still don’t get why you were so hooked on SHIELD. It was just a rejected letter.” Bucky said, Y/N froze, removing her arms from his waist.

“Bucky, joining SHIELD was my dream. I spent my college years prepping for that application. I trained myself just so I snag a chance at becoming an agent.”

“Well, that was a dream well wasted and dumb. You could be saving lives and instead you’re doin paperwork”

Y/N froze, her heart dipping. Bucky’s gaze remained on the mail.

“W-What?”

“Doll, your job is practically a water downed version of a SHIELD agent. Your better off working some other 9-5 job. Forget the dream, it was pretty dumb anyways.”

“Take that back.” Y/N said slowly. She felt her throat constrict.

“What? I’m speaking the truth. Sometimes I feel kind of embarrassed telling the guys your a CIA agent. Everyone knows you just shag officials for intel and call it a case that’s worth working on.”

“If that’s what you think, why don’t you just go find someone who’s got a more worthy job.” Y/N snapped. Bucky looked at her.

“Oh come on, don’t be like that. I was just talking to the guys earlier and that’s the kind of shit-”

“You called my dream a waste.” Y/N said slowly, gazing at him. Tears began to well in her eyes.

“I’m being honest, Y/N.”

“Then leave.”

Bucky froze, irritation evident on his face.

“Why do you have to be so fucking difficult all the time? I feel like I’m constantly walking on eggshells.”

“Then fucking leave you douche bag, maybe it’ll make you feel better!” The tears were now pouring and Y/N hated herself for it. 

“If you just considered for a second what I said-”

“You literally told me my dream is shit and I should move on. That I’m embarrassing you? God, Bucky you’re supposed to support my decisions! Not fucking drag them. Is that not what comes with loving your partner-”

“Then maybe I don’t fucking love you.”

He regretted it the moment the sentence left his lips. He watched Y/N’s face fall. Her chin began to quiver. He wanted to punch himself over and over and over again.

 She staggered to their bedroom and locked the door. Bucky raced after her, banging on the door. He could hear her sobs and small hiccups. Each cry was like bullet to the heart and he desperately wanted to apologize. Y/N didn’t budge for the next hour and Bucky’s voice grew hoarse from calling out to her. He was irritated that morning. Sam was joking around, poking fun at the CIA. Eventually Y/N’s name came up. Bucky knew it was a joke but he couldn’t help but feel the sting when Sam poked fun at Y/N. He had called Sam out for it but it had clouded his mind for the rest of the morning. Now he let his mouth run and was paying the price. 

Bucky tried to pry the door open several hours later. Surprisingly, the door knob gave in. Y/N was in bed, the sheets covering her body. The moonlight cast a sad glow and he could see her tear stained cheeks from where he stood. Bucky was overcome with guilt and slowly approached the bed. He sat beside Y/N’s sleeping figure and softly cradled her cheek. She shot up awake, breathing hard.

“Buck-” She whispered, clearly distraught. Bucky frowned. She had a nightmare.

“God, Y/N. I am so sorry-”

“Don’t-”

“Just please let me explain myself.” He whispered, his eyes pleading. Y/N looked away, shrugging from his grasp.

“Sam was joking about the rivalry between the CIA and SHIELD this morning. I knew he was kidding around but he referred to your job and it just got to me. I am so fucking sorry, I am so incredibly wrong for saying those things. You’re dream means everything to me. You mean everything to me. I am so sorry, I should not have blown up at you. It was wrong and I love you- God, I love you so much.” Bucky bent his head.

“I am not asking for forgiveness but I just want you to know I am so incredibly sorry.” He rasped. Y/N took a deep breath and grabbed his arm. Bucky looked at her and she could see the sorrow behind his glassy blue eyes. She leaned closer to him, brushing her fingers against his cheekbones.

“It’s okay. You fucked up. But you apologized and that’s important. Just don’t be an asshole ever again?”

“You have my word.” He mumbled. Y/N leaned into kiss him, grasping his metal arm for support. It started slow and Bucky could taste the salty tears on her lips. He broke away.

“I am so fucking sorry Y/N.”

She wound her hands in his hair and tugged him closer to her. He crawled on top of her, kissing her softly. Slowly the kisses turned more ragged and Y/N found herself rolling her hips against him. He removed his clothes wordlessly as did she, the two focused on feeling each other. Bucky kissed every inch of her body, following her movements to guide his mouth.

“Buck-” Y/N muttered, cradling his face. He took that as approval and slowly entered her, placing his forehead against hers. Y/N moaned at the feeling, adjusting to his size. Bucky muttered apologies and ‘i love you’s’ into each thrust and Y/N clutched onto his shoulders, feeling a euphoric wave spread across her body. Slowly, the two of them became more rigid before coming undone.

“I love you, you know that right?”

“Yes Buck. It’s not like you told me a hundred times already.” Y/N said softly, a glowing smile on her face. Bucky pressed his lips against hers.

“Depends.”

Talia had ended up leaving earlier with her date and informed Y/N with a text and a promise of breakfast on her the following morning. Bucky offered to walk her home.

“I had fun tonight.” He mumbled.

“Can’t say the same.” She replied, leaning on the door frame. The two chuckled softly before falling in a comfortable silence. Y/N was buzzing, either from the alcohol or Bucky. She couldn’t tell but she didn’t want the feeling to go away.

“Would it be weird to kiss you right now?” He asked after a moment. Y/N froze, her voice betraying her. She shook her head and Bucky took the small gesture as a yes, bending his head and tentatively pressing his lips onto hers. His lips were warm and tasted sweet. Y/N hummed against him, almost sighing with relief. His hands cupped her jaw softly and Y/N tugged at the collar of his suit almost as if to brace herself. He broke away.

“I’ll see you later, yeah?”

“Later” turned into a date, and one date turned into many. Before they knew it, the two were engaged and later married. 

“I still can’t believe you hated me.” Bucky mumbled, filing through the mail.

“I didn’t hate you, I hated the fact that you have history with SHIELD.” Y/N responded, wrapping her arms around his waist. The two had spent the morning recounting their history as a means of passing time. 

“Right, so pent up anger on an agency correlates with being angry at a random guy.”

“You brought up my rejection every time we met!” She responded, pressing ghost kisses against his neck. 

“I still don’t get why you were so hooked on SHIELD. It was just a rejected letter.” Bucky said, Y/N froze, removing her arms from his waist.

“Bucky, joining SHIELD was my dream. I spent my college years prepping for that application. I trained myself just so I snag a chance at becoming an agent.”

“Well, that was a dream well wasted and dumb. You could be saving lives and instead you’re doin paperwork”

Y/N froze, her heart dipping. Bucky’s gaze remained on the mail.

“W-What?”

“Doll, your job is practically a water downed version of a SHIELD agent. Your better off working some other 9-5 job. Forget the dream, it was pretty dumb anyways.”

“Take that back.” Y/N said slowly. She felt her throat constrict.

“What? I’m speaking the truth. Sometimes I feel kind of embarrassed telling the guys your a CIA agent. Everyone knows you just shag officials for intel and call it a case that’s worth working on.”

“If that’s what you think, why don’t you just go find someone who’s got a more worthy job.” Y/N snapped. Bucky looked at her.

“Oh come on, don’t be like that. I was just talking to the guys earlier and that’s the kind of shit-”

“You called my dream a waste.” Y/N said slowly, gazing at him. Tears began to well in her eyes.

“I’m being honest, Y/N.”

“Then leave.”

Bucky froze, irritation evident on his face.

“Why do you have to be so fucking difficult all the time? I feel like I’m constantly walking on eggshells.”

“Then fucking leave you douche bag, maybe it’ll make you feel better!” The tears were now pouring and Y/N hated herself for it. 

“If you just considered for a second what I said-”

“You literally told me my dream is shit and I should move on. That I’m embarrassing you? God, Bucky you’re supposed to support my decisions! Not fucking drag them. Is that not what comes with loving your partner-”

“Then maybe I don’t fucking love you.”

He regretted it the moment the sentence left his lips. He watched Y/N’s face fall. Her chin began to quiver. He wanted to punch himself over and over and over again.

 She staggered to their bedroom and locked the door. Bucky raced after her, banging on the door. He could hear her sobs and small hiccups. Each cry was like bullet to the heart and he desperately wanted to apologize. Y/N didn’t budge for the next hour and Bucky’s voice grew hoarse from calling out to her. He was irritated that morning. Sam was joking around, poking fun at the CIA. Eventually Y/N’s name came up. Bucky knew it was a joke but he couldn’t help but feel the sting when Sam poked fun at Y/N. He had called Sam out for it but it had clouded his mind for the rest of the morning. Now he let his mouth run and was paying the price. 

Bucky tried to pry the door open several hours later. Surprisingly, the door knob gave in. Y/N was in bed, the sheets covering her body. The moonlight cast a sad glow and he could see her tear stained cheeks from where he stood. Bucky was overcome with guilt and slowly approached the bed. He sat beside Y/N’s sleeping figure and softly cradled her cheek. She shot up awake, breathing hard.

“Buck-” She whispered, clearly distraught. Bucky frowned. She had a nightmare.

“God, Y/N. I am so sorry-”

“Don’t-”

“Just please let me explain myself.” He whispered, his eyes pleading. Y/N looked away, shrugging from his grasp.

“Sam was joking about the rivalry between the CIA and SHIELD this morning. I knew he was kidding around but he referred to your job and it just got to me. I am so fucking sorry, I am so incredibly wrong for saying those things. You’re dream means everything to me. You mean everything to me. I am so sorry, I should not have blown up at you. It was wrong and I love you- God, I love you so much.” Bucky bent his head.

“I am not asking for forgiveness but I just want you to know I am so incredibly sorry.” He rasped. Y/N took a deep breath and grabbed his arm. Bucky looked at her and she could see the sorrow behind his glassy blue eyes. She leaned closer to him, brushing her fingers against his cheekbones.

“It’s okay. You fucked up. But you apologized and that’s important. Just don’t be an asshole ever again?”

“You have my word.” He mumbled. Y/N leaned into kiss him, grasping his metal arm for support. It started slow and Bucky could taste the salty tears on her lips. He broke away.

“I am so fucking sorry Y/N.”

She wound her hands in his hair and tugged him closer to her. He crawled on top of her, kissing her softly. Slowly the kisses turned more ragged and Y/N found herself rolling her hips against him. He removed his clothes wordlessly as did she, the two focused on feeling each other. Bucky kissed every inch of her body, following her movements to guide his mouth.

“Buck-” Y/N muttered, cradling his face. He took that as approval and slowly entered her, placing his forehead against hers. Y/N moaned at the feeling, adjusting to his size. Bucky muttered apologies and ‘i love you’s’ into each thrust and Y/N clutched onto his shoulders, feeling a euphoric wave spread across her body. Slowly, the two of them became more rigid before coming undone.

“I love you, you know that right?”

“Yes Buck. It’s not like you told me a hundred times already.” Y/N said softly, a glowing smile on her face. Bucky pressed his lips against hers.

body:

Tony = Konata (personalities)

Bruce = Miyuki (smart/destructive on account of her clumsiness)

Bye

summary: Fun Day - Loki Laufeyson
title: Fun Day - Loki Laufeyson
body:
• 30 with Lokiiii 💚🐍
  • Hi lovey! Can you please do a Loki x reader with 34 and 47 please and thank you :)))))))

Requested By: @bririshstiles

Prompts: (30) “Want me to stab them?” (34) “Your idea of fun always involves breaking the law.” (47) “You are the biggest disaster i’ve ever seen.” 

Please don’t plagiarize my work - I spend a lot of my time writing, copying and pasting destroys that. If you want to repost my work. please ask first - but even then I might say no.

Word Count: 340

-

“Your idea of fun always involves breaking the law.”

Snorting, you rolled your eyes. “People usually say that about you.”

Loki smirked, crossing his arms in front of you. Raising an eyebrow, you shook your head, sauntering over to him. “Come on,” you teased, pulling on the collars of his suit. “You’re all dressed up anyway, why can’t we have a bit of fun.”

“Because, Midgardians already hate me,” Loki sighed, “i’d like not to cause more destruction.”

“Hey,” you called, rising your heads by your side, “that was your disaster. I didn’t even know you then.”

Loki glared; “you are the biggest disaster i’ve ever seen.” 

Frowning, you pouted. “First off, rude,” you snapped, “second, please!! I wanna visit Midgard.”

“Fine,” Loki huffed, reaching forward and wrapping his arm around your waist, A grin instantly grew on your lips as clapped, leaning into his embrace as you waited for yourself to arrive in Midgard. It had happened quick enough, and soon you were staring around with wonder.

“It never ceases to amaze you.” Loki teased, rolling his eyes at your giddy expression.

“What?” You snapped teasingly, “I rarely get to come here! It’s always so exciting when I do.”

You turned, hand wrapped around Loki’s wrist. You raised your foot, ready to take a step before a body came barreling into you. You stumbled back, a gasp leaving your lips as your eyes widened in surprise. You watched the rather rude man who’d bump into you continue walking as if nothing had happened.

Instantly, Loki geared into your defence. “Want me to stab them?”

Halting him from grabbing his knives, you collected yourself. “No, no, it’s fine. Let’s just go, okay?” You grinned, “you promised me a fun day in Midgard.”

Loki reluctantly nodded, but not without glancing back at the man, mentally scheming what he’d do later.

-

let me know what you thought? remember, reblogging always helps!

requests are closed!

body:

This is for calligraphy and lettering practice! I will post some of them on here!

But all of them will be posted on my calligraphy account on Instagram (@ calligraphyintherain)! So please please, send me your favorite iconic quotes from the movie!

Thank you!
